website_summaries.verdict: Choose this set if you are looking for pencils with soft, thick cores.
pros: Set of 48 is a solid mid-range choice with a decent selection of colors geared toward developing artists
Robust, durable leads are crack- and chip-resistant, so they last for a while if well cared for
cons: Gradient color assortment, so don't expect extreme colors in this set

customer_reviews.title: RECEIVED USED PENCILS
customer_reviews.text: Totally disappointed. The tin was not in a wrapping. All the pencils had come out loose in the outer box. To make it worse the pencils were NOT the same length. It was obvious many had been used and one was an inch shorter than most. Lots were blunted by use. I'm awaiting my replacement set.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: The smoothest, most versatile pencils I've ever used. ...
customer_reviews.text: The smoothest, most versatile pencils I've ever used. I will be a repeat customer. I only wish I used more colors in my life!
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: A coloring dream for this cripple!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these pencils... like butter. I have severe Rheumatoid RA in my hands(fusions, joint replacements, etc...) and could not color for long with basic crayola pencil crayons due to having to press so hard in order to get a rich color effect. In fact I gave up coloring and started using watercolor paints instead but those can ruin coloring book pages. These are like a dream and blend so well! The best Christmas gift ever!!! I found a site and some local stores that sell individual colors. I am hooked!!! Also, no issues with lead breakage here and they sharpen well. I'm in artistic heaven! Image shows how easy to blend the different shades of blues and blacks.
customer_reviews.author: Zeebootee

customer_reviews.title: An Art Essential
customer_reviews.text: These were perfect!! Creamy, vibrant, and beautiful. This had no duplicates in this set. Instead, it has a vast array of colors and many various shades of colors. None of them had damage, and so far, I haven't come across any with broken led. I am a more than happy, and feel like this set is fantastic for anyone who enjoys art. I know that next time I'm planning on buying an even bigger set. In this drawing, I used tan toned paper and these perfect prismacolors!
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Rourke

customer_reviews.title: My only complaint is that I don't have more.
customer_reviews.text: Great pencils, my only complaint is that I didn't get the 150 set. I have always used prismacolor pencils. I find that using white to blend works much better on color work, the colorless blenders work great in doing the dark areas and really flattening your blacks. I use these on gray toned paper, it gives the colors an even playing field and makes the white really pop. They're simply fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Danny Smash

customer_reviews.title: Great product, bad shipping protection.
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my wife, and she loves it. Well made and the colors are true and nice. However, the tip of one of the pencils is broken. Th reason for that is the box of pencil was not wrapped completely in bubble wrap for shipping, and the shipper just threw the box to our door from 6 feet away! For something as delicate as these pencils, Amazon needs to package the product better in order to prevent the animals from shipping services from destroying it. Now we don't know if the leads of the pencils are broken inside because it was thrown to our door. I guess only time will tell...
customer_reviews.author: AmazonShopper

customer_reviews.title: Not great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I like the pencils for the most part except they seem kinda cheap. The color selection of the 48 collection is nice. Two of the pencils seem to be the same color. The biggest complaint is that one of the pencils broke a half an inch down the pencil the first time I sharpened it. It seems like the wood used for the pencils is really cheap. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: I don’t know why I keep trying these pencils! ...
customer_reviews.text: I don’t know why I keep trying these pencils! When you have to sharpen them the lead keeps breaking! Have finally learned my lesson.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for beginners
customer_reviews.text: Not bad for beginners. The only thing is the weird smell of the pencils... kinda like some kind of spice... or pizza... Update: I have been using them for several days and they are doing ok. One thing is that The colors are really vivid and creamy...not a very good thing for me to draw flowers since lots of them are light and clear color... The colors are not enough for me, so I mixed them with other pencils sometimes and The result is good.
customer_reviews.author: Anna

customer_reviews.title: No quality control at all.
customer_reviews.text: My PC914 Cream pencil has a crack down the entire side of it from end to tip. These are supposedly "artist" grade and "artist" quality pencils but they have absolutely no quality control. Also my PC922 is missing paint on the side. Hopefully my leads don't break continuously like others have had. If a new paint tube had a crack down the entire side through to the core that would be completely unacceptable and this should be too.
customer_reviews.author: Thaddeus Garman

customer_reviews.title: vivid color, and they don’t break! sharpen with Prismacolor sharpener
customer_reviews.text: I bought 48 color Premier and 12 color Verithin pencils. The Verithins hold their point relatively nicely, and the Premiers nicely lay down color, which I use more on the edge than the point. I’ve sharpened them a few times and each time I’m aware that they sharpen without difficulty, meaning minimal waste. The Premiers blend with water, while the Verithins don’t. They play nicely with wax crayon, water crayon, pastel and the occasional acrylic pen. Paper with a texture, in my opinion, has a more pleasing result than untextured. While the leads ar not all centered, that has not been a problem. The Prismacolor sharpener doesn’t mind, so keeps the points nice even though they’re not centered.
customer_reviews.author: hepsy

customer_reviews.title: Great Colored Pencils
customer_reviews.text: I really like the variety of colors in this pencil set. I do a lot of blending and mixing of colors when I color and the waxiness of these pencils allows that to happen. I bought a Pro Art pencil sharpener to use with these pencils and it works great, very little if any breakage with this sharpener. I loved this pencil set so much I bought 150 pencil set. This set I take with me in my car to use when I have to wait for a period of time, very portable. The other set I keep in my studio. Very happy with this purchase
customer_reviews.author: Diane Howey

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality
customer_reviews.text: These were such a waste of money. The leads keep breaking, and continue to break as I sharpen them. This has happened to 6 of them so far and they are now useless. Its probably too late to return them unfortunately, but terrible quality.
customer_reviews.author: melissa

customer_reviews.title: only two things  NOT to  love with Prismaolor
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased hundreds of dollars worth PrismaColor Colored pancils in the past & continue to do so. These are my only points of concern with PrismaColor pencils: 1) Price, price PRICE! They are expensive. 2) In coloring a lot of Christmas pictures, I have found that there is not a really clear, Chirstmasy red that I associate with Christmas colors. Well, there you have it, folks........my two main objections to PrismaColor Colored Pencils.
customer_reviews.author: an honest review

customer_reviews.title: I love my pencils
customer_reviews.text: Got these and printed a bunch of the adult coloring pages off of the internet. It was so fun! They also have a good chalkboard effect on the black paper for teacher appreciation week.
customer_reviews.author: Danica

customer_reviews.title: Top notch colored pencils for artist everywhere ! See pics
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this pencil set . I have bought for my mom to use for years . She has colored adult and children’s books for years and with the Covid lock down , what better way to have her spend her time. These sharpen great and are highest quality pencils for college and art students alike . Do buy the sharpener as well - you don’t need the electric one , if a senior can use with ease most people can and she says it’s easy and all pencils come out Perfect!
customer_reviews.author: mitzybaby03

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as i was expecting...
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like these. The lead is constantly breaking when we try to sharpen, and we bought the prismacolor sharpener. For the price, and all of the positive reviews, I thought these were supposed to be the very best. Quite frankly, some of the cheaper ones I own seem to work better. The colors are nice however when the pencil is able to hold a point. The sharpening issue seems to more problematic with certain colors, especially the pink, which is my daughter's favorite, so it is getting pretty short because of the constant sharpening issue. I bought these on sale, so I wonder if there was a bad batch, hence the price reduction??
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Strange numbering system and color selection
customer_reviews.text: These are nice pencils but I can't give them 5 stars because I do not understand the numbering system or how they chose the colors to include. I was expecting the primary and secondary colors on the RYB color wheel; and hopefully, the tertiary colors too. Instead I got two trays of strangely organized pencils, none of which was Purple. 48 colored pencils without one of the secondary colors. Seriously? It is difficult to produce standard color schemes (e.g., complementary, analogous, rectangle, square, etc.) with these pencils.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: not what I thought
customer_reviews.text: I was (I thought) supposed to get 48 differant colors, got 2 of each. colors are not anywhere as bright as I thought. Dull, is what I would call them. very dissappointed.I would not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: SAMMIE

customer_reviews.title: Three reasons why I will not buy this again
customer_reviews.text: 1. Misshapened and damaged pencils 2. Pencil leads not centered 3. Colors do not match naming
customer_reviews.author: AL

customer_reviews.title: Roy G. Biv loves these...
customer_reviews.text: These are the best color pencils I've ever used...I always thought it was all hype until someone finally let me try them. They're so silky and buttery you could've put it on toast...but that would have been an awful meal and a waste of pigment. If you can get these it's definitely worth the money...get the colorless blenders and you'll be golden. Art it up and have a great day.
customer_reviews.author: ADAM J. CANTU

customer_reviews.title: Awesome pencils but not ideal for coloring books
customer_reviews.text: These are really nice colored pencils. Very soft leads provides good color saturation. They are fun to work with. For art projects, they are the best--for coloring books (my primary use for them) the leads are actually a little TOO soft. It's difficult to keep them sharpened to a nice sharp point and with my frequent sharpening, i am going through the pencils at an alarming rate. A few of the leads were broken on arrival, and prismacolor was very good about replacing the broken ones--no questions asked. I'd highly recommend these for creating original artwork. If you're just using them for coloring books you might be just as well off going with a cheaper set.
customer_reviews.author: Natalie Hart

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Colors
customer_reviews.text: I've wanted them for a long time and they are exactly what I hoped for. Worth the extra cost for premium colors. Other name brand color pencils do not even compare in richness, how long they last and the amount of pressure needed. The ability to do shading, outlining and even just mixing two colors on a page close together is unmatched. It works perfect with my inspire bible
customer_reviews.author: The Social Entrepreneur

customer_reviews.title: Some toxic pencils included which requires to wash hands immediately after use!
customer_reviews.text: While colors are good, very pigmented, glides easily... the package came with an upsetting warning that some colors might be toxic, wash hands immediately after using them! This warning is nowhere to be seen when you are ordering it! It should be clearly placed so people can make an informed decision before they order! I was going to share these colors with my kids.. as it said on website that it’s for adults and children projects! Now my kids will be no where near these pencils!
customer_reviews.author: jk

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Pencils
customer_reviews.text: This is my second and larger set of these pencils. I now see the 70 something set is on sale, and oh how I wish I had bought that. These come in a super nice tin, with little separate type things, so your pencils stay straight. You don't have to move all the pencils to put one back in, you just put it in. The color is fantastic, and I'm told by others it will last for years and I believe them. Those cheap Crayola pencils have nothing on Prismacolor.
customer_reviews.author: footloose 321

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy
customer_reviews.text: Don’t bother. The pencils do not sharpen well. I bought the Prismacolor sharpener and the tips break right in the sharpener!
customer_reviews.author: Miss Sophia

customer_reviews.title: so it's been a labor of love up to now
customer_reviews.text: I am not an artist. I am not a student in art classes. I am a housewife who likes to color in "grown up" coloring books. I have wanted this set ever since an artist friend of mine told me about them. My hands hurt with cheaper pencils, and I prefer to color with pencils over markers or crayons or anything else, so it's been a labor of love up to now. The color from these pencils is amazing, and my hands have not hurt while coloring since I got them! It's fabulous, and I highly recommend these to anyone who wants a good quality set of coloring pencils. I am very happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brandy Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Ordered for my daughter away at college. She didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: Ordered for my daughter away at college. She didn't use them for awhile after she got them. But when she opened, she noted that more than half of the leads were busted inside the pencils.. Too late to send back.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Justin

customer_reviews.title: Best pencil out there..reasonably priced!
customer_reviews.text: I finally bought the biggest set Prismacolor premiere puts out! I started with 48, then 72, then 120 and finally invested in the biggie! No other pencil compares to the vivid, smooth colors of premieres! Not for beginners! If you are an ameteur try the Prismacolor scholar pencils before buying these. Then you will be ready for using the premieres! Love, love, love them! Plus they are now reasonably priced! I couldn’t afford them at the price a couple yrs. ago. So good to use the best pencil out there!
customer_reviews.author: PurlyQTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Original Prismacolor pencil case👍
customer_reviews.text: This actually surprised both of us me and my daughter. They are very good quality pencils. My daughter loves to draw this was the perfect birthday gift she could have asked for. Definitely recommend. As you can she use some of them for a wonderful cause🥰 I will add more pictures in my second review.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy P.

customer_reviews.title: I hate that they sometimes break so easy or you have ...
customer_reviews.text: Got these as well as fabercastell ones at the same time. I hate that they sometimes break so easy or you have to sharpen them so many times that it reaches the end already so I would sharpen it with a blade to get more out of the product. Other than that, these colored pencils have a more scratchy texture and it's nice to have a bunch of vibrant colors. There's plenty to have just for the studio and some to bring out to sketch. I also feel that after using these pencils, it's important to keep washing your hands if you want clean work. Sometimes the powder would get onto my hands and smudge into the paper.
customer_reviews.author: Ivy

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pencils! I have only used cheaper pencils to this point and I had no idea what I was missing. With the cheaper pencils, the strokes on the pages were visible, but these blend so amazingly! I don't think I could pick out a single stroke! Love love love! I will definitely purchase these (or the larger kit) again!
customer_reviews.author: MadZalice

customer_reviews.title: The best pencils by far
customer_reviews.text: Since buying these pencils, I have bought the 150 pack. I loved these so much that it encouraged me to start using coloured pencils as a medium rather than just markers and pens. These have a brilliant colour variety and lay down smooth, beautiful colour. They are ideal for adult colouring books and general art projects. They are easy to sharpen with the prismacolor hand held sharpener and the tips seem nice and strong. The tin they come in is useful and reusable. Overall, I am thrilled with these and would definitely recommend them to other artists and crafters.
customer_reviews.author: Ionia FromentTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Vibrant on Paper
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic quality for the price. I've bought more expensive pencils for my youngest that could never compare to the quality of Prismacolor Premier Colored Pencils. I got 48 pencils for under $15! The blending aspect is excellent, with low smudging, and the colors are vibrant and stay that way - even on regular copy paper. If you want great colored pencils for a low price, this is the way to go. For a gift? Send this instead of the sets that include the minor things such as pencil sharpener or paper, so the recipient can experience these true to color pencils.
customer_reviews.author: Sheri

customer_reviews.title: Prismacolor Premier Color Pencils
customer_reviews.text: When I got these colored pencils I was so impressed! The first thing I noticed when using them, is if you are coloring on really good quality paper these pencils are so soft, and color beautifully. If you are coloring on, for example normal quality paper, you may have to push a little harder for it to fully color in. These pencils however are just beautiful, and come with an awesome variety of colors to use in your artwork!
customer_reviews.author: Melisa

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful colors and texture buuuuuut
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful colors and texture, but here's a picture of two of my BRAND NEW pencils. One unused and one sharpened once. They wouldn't hold a point because of how broken the led was! I own a very nice pencil sharpener and I'm an experienced artist. My pencils were shipped in a box, all loose and rollin around with other stuff. Either it was on sale because prismacolor or amazon was aware of the damage to the pencils, or amazon wants my art to be sad. I'm super dissatisfied with this, I am wasting wasting wasting product and money. I have work to do!!! Still though. Stunning colors.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great set of colored pencil
customer_reviews.text: The product arrived in perfect condition. I absolutely love this medium and use it to elaborate my watercolor paintings and to put emphasis on some parts. I was surprised to see that they lay down, slide on paper and blend very easily. If you want to catch smooth transactions using Prismacolor in your watercolor paintings I can recommend you to use ‘hot pressed’ watercolor paper which contains less texture so blending would be much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Zeki

customer_reviews.title: A little too soft for my skill level
customer_reviews.text: I'm uneducated on colored pencils (but I'm figuring it out). These have wonderful colors, but they're softer "lead", which I'm still figuring out. I think they look like I used a crayon when I use them in my adult coloring books, but that must be me. The colors are beautiful and vibrant. The quality is the best I've seen (again, newbie @ colored pencils). I'd definitely recommend them for someone who knows what they're doing. I will look to see if this company makes a harder "lead" set, and if they do I will purchase them again.
customer_reviews.author: Alena

customer_reviews.title: Nice starter set for my 30 year old son!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty amazing pencils but not for me this time.. I decided to let my son in on the benefits joys of having quality colored pencils and Hes hooked now. He preferred gel pens up until I tried him on the Marco Raffines. That got his interest piqued so then I decided Id completely win him over to colored pencils and Prismas did the trick. Now we can move on up the scale if we want to but Hes on his own now. Hes totally hooked on colored pencils now. Prismas will do it to you every time.
customer_reviews.author: S. Conley

customer_reviews.title: Great for all skill levels!
customer_reviews.text: I decided to pick these up after reading rave reviews. The reviews don't lie! I am a novice colorist but these make coloring so easy. The color lays down with little pressure so your hand doesn't get tired. The colors are vibrant and with 48 in the set, you get a nice variety for anything you are working on. My set arrived shrink wrapped with only one broken tip. The tin is very convenient for storage. These pencils are so worth adding to your supplies, especially if you can find them for a great price like Amazon had this month!
customer_reviews.author: chrelaine

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Upgrade for Beginners
customer_reviews.text: If the tin were as handy looking as it is in the picture, these would be perfect. The reality is once you try to use the pencils? The two trays will end up spilling all over the place which is really annoying so I got a zipper case for mine. The pencils themselves are nice, the color is smoother than the regular Crayola/Rose Art type pencils which can take some getting used to! I'm not quite enough of a connoisseur to describe it other than they have a different hand. They take less pressure to transfer color to the page than less expensive brands and the pigments are pretty intense.
customer_reviews.author: KathyDTop Contributor: Knitting

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing and underwhelming
customer_reviews.text: I've used PC902 ultramarine (blue) on one medallion on one page(the blue and yellow one) and because it keeps breaking I've gone through 1/3 Of the pencil. Pictures included. I doubt I'll replace any when they're used up, but will go with another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Donna Greene

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Rainbow of colors....
customer_reviews.text: I love these colored pencils. I purchased both the Thornton's coloring pencils and these and Prismacolor Premier pencils are my favorite to use. I sponsor 2 young girls from Tanzania and among the items that they love to receive are drawings. Since even my stickmen are horrible, I thought if I could color things and send that they would maybe like them. Crayons weren't doing it but these pencils are beautiful and the rainbow of colors is stunning. My colored pages are a hit in Tanzania. What I didn't expect is how calming and relaxing coloring really is.
customer_reviews.author: angelslegacy

customer_reviews.title: High-quality pencils
customer_reviews.text: I’m not an artist, so I’m reviewing these as a non-professional consumer. The pigment used to create the pencils seems high-quality because the colors transfer and blend easily. We have used them for coloring books, school projects, art projects on heavy paper and just sketching on regular lined paper. It’s a huge difference using these pencils vs. using the cheap ones I normally buy for my daughter’s school supplies.
customer_reviews.author: fergus

customer_reviews.title: Amazing pencils
customer_reviews.text: I was worried about getting these pencils since some reviews say that they break easily. They do not break easily and I have broken some of the tips on accident (I just press too hard); however, it's been fine to sharpen (they do not become super small and unusable after you sharpen a few times). I would definitely recommend getting as the colors are amazing and I will definitely buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My opinion about prisma colors
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my 11 year old son and this is what he had to say... Prisma colors are worth getting, they have a wide span variety of colors you can choose from. These special color pencils can be closely merged to create a beautiful spectrum, these prestigous color pencils can be used for standard artwork advanced artwork and true masterpieces.Prisma colors are amazing and wonderful the creation of prisma color is truly outstanding all great artists should use. Though it is hard to bond these colors they still are the best. If you love the prima color brand they have other accessories such as markers pastels and pencils. Enjoy your prima set.
customer_reviews.author: The Odd Couple

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The tin the pencils came in is dented and difficult to open because the tin is warped. Some of the pencils are also dented. The pencils are nice enough. I hope the dented wood does not affect the cores when they are sharpened. Given the price point, I would expect the tin would be in better shape. I will need to buy a case for the pencils. Not worth the hassle to return.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You Reviewers Rock!
customer_reviews.text: To all reviewers: experts, professionals, experienced and just plain people having fun: thank you. Your reviews were influential in making my decision to buy them. These pencils went to an 89 year old woman with weak hands and arms. Her joy has become her new art book with highly detailed fill-in-the-colors drawings thanks to these pencils. The lead in the pencils that came with the book were far too hard, leaving a very light color on the page. These lay down much more vibrant and satisfying color. Enough to make an aging woman with weak hands and heart smile all day.
customer_reviews.author: M. Schwabe

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: This was may second purchase. I thought it was a good brand. The worse case of color pencils. Every time you want to sharpen them they broke. I wish I had returned them.
customer_reviews.author: Smart buyer

customer_reviews.title: High Quality Blending Colored Pencils
customer_reviews.text: I gave these to my girlfriend for her birthday as a gift, because she needed them while taking classes for Ryman Arts. They worked phenomenal and blended well. It’s been a year since then and she still had them. They came safe and well. They don’t break easily and are worth their price
customer_reviews.author: Jason L

customer_reviews.title: This is my answer
customer_reviews.text: I was really worried before I got this color pencils. I researched a lot of website and read ton of reviews, because I don't wanted to waste my time and money. If you're worry like me, this color pencils are your answer. Very soft, but not too much. Very bright colors, some colors are so unique. Very valuable... You'll be satisfied with results. I am so happy with this color pencils.
customer_reviews.author: asami

customer_reviews.title: update: VERY disappointed that some of the colors keep breaking when sharpened
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely amazing!! These pencils are by far the best pencils I've ever used. Nice strong lead that sharpens perfectly every time nice point, no flaking or smudging. These pencils are excellent for blending. I'm impressed'''' A+
customer_reviews.author: Tonya C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Colored Pncil My Wife has ever Tried.
customer_reviews.text: This was a present for my wife. She has very limited eye site but still enjoys making greeting cards. When she tries to use felt pins they leave a mark when she is trying to get the tip in the correct. With the Prisma Colored Pencils she can get the tip in the correct spot and since the color is very "deep" she gets good coverage as she would with a felt tip pen but without the mess. She was very excited the white prisma covered so well. I am certain these are the best colored pencils she has ever used and the color selection covered all of her requirements. I will definitely buy again when these are gone.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Buffington

customer_reviews.title: Great Quality Pencils!
customer_reviews.text: I love these pencils! I bought a less expensive set of 72 pencils first and although they are good, decided to try the Prismacolor 48 pack just to see the difference between the two. The Prismacolor pencils are truly awesome! They blend well and sharpen great. I haven't noticed any issues with breakage when I use pressure to blend or darken. Even though this set is only 48, the colors are so varied that I find myself using these all the time. I've only been pencil coloring for a short time but I can see why these are so rated so well by others. There is a difference between these and the less expensive brand I purchased first.
customer_reviews.author: JaniceBTop Contributor: Coloring

customer_reviews.title: Many pencils arrived broken inside
customer_reviews.text: This is my second review, for some reason my last one was unaccepted by Amazon, I didn't used improper language. I used Prismacalor years ago, and this set of pencils is a lower quality product, the pencils tips brake off easily, if I sharpen them , the color bar is broken inside, every pencil said they are , made in Mexico, unfortunately with this experience I cant buy pencils again online, I got them for a future trip with some adult coloring books and now I don't have time to but another set before my trip, very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Andre75

customer_reviews.title: Great colored pencils
customer_reviews.text: Great colored pencils! I was using my old set of pencils and having a hard time coloring for a long time because you had to push hard to get the color out. The difference with these is night and day. They have really vibrant colors that you can shade really easily. The harder you press the brighter they are and they flow really smoothly on to the paper. They also don't smear or transfer on to your hand at all if you go over where you've already colored. All around everything I could ask for from colored pencils.
customer_reviews.author: J. Powell

customer_reviews.title: Best pencils around, at any price!
customer_reviews.text: I found these at a great price here on Amazon and took the plunge...you won't be sorry! These are very versatile soft pencils, I've never used a colored pencil anywhere near as nice as these, and trust me, I've tried MANY brands, at all price points. I rarely used pencil in my art before, because it was uncomfortable on my hands, but these are very comfortable to use and I love the results! This set has every color you might want, and they blend like butter. Also, though they are soft, they don't require frequent sharpening as some others do. I was pleasantly surprised how well they work on canvas board, as well. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: RDH

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for! I splurged on these and am so glad I did. I started adult coloring last year with printed pictures and a basic set of colored pencils. Not satisfied for long, I now have coloring books plus expanding sets of markers, pens and pencils. So far the Prismacolor pencils are the best! This set has a wonderful selection of colors and the pencils are great for blending, shading and layering with their soft, smooth leads. I also love that each pencil is labeled with the color name and they came in trays in a metal storage box.
customer_reviews.author: Avid Reader

customer_reviews.title: Rich colors, soft core, excellent product for serious beginners
customer_reviews.text: Excellent pencils with variety of colors in rich pigments. Pencils have a medium-Soft core that blends well. I recommend a "colored pencil" type of sharpener to preserve as much pencil as possible when requiring a sharp point. Otherwise, your pencil will be sharpened away quickly. It is the trade-off we make for wanting these soft, rich colors that blend so well.
customer_reviews.author: stillastudent

customer_reviews.title: Meh, not much different from regular colored pencils
customer_reviews.text: I’m not sure if it is the seller or the brand but compared to regular colored pencils, I can’t find a huge difference. These were not soft and creamy at all and not a ton of opportunity for shading. It felt like a bit of a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Carol

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I like these pencils, but some of them keep breaking when I sharpen them. I'm gentle and handling them without much pressure, but a few of them have continued to break until there is nothing left to sharpen. It seems that color inside the pencils is in pieces. I've wasted half of one of the blue colors, and one of the purple colors because I keep trying to sharpen it and get to a place that's not broken. I finally gave up on the blue because it just comes out in pieces and can not be used.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesomeness!
customer_reviews.text: I don't have anything to compare these to because this is the first time I have ever bought colored pencils (other than in 4th grade when I must have colored maps, but don't remember) These are wonderful pencils with beautiful colors, which blend and layer very nicely. The other day I decided to go to Michaels to buy more (because I get obsessed with things like this) and found the SAME EXACT PACK, only they are asking $229.00! Are you freaking kidding me right now?!? Needless to say, I removed my jaw from the tile on the floor and headed back out to the parking lot. Never looked back. Yes, these are definitely worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Darla

customer_reviews.title: I really enjoy these pencils!
customer_reviews.text: There's something about putting a good colored pencil to fresh white paper that I love. I really really really (no, really) enjoy these pencils. The color goes on so nice and bold, if needed. Blends very well. Slight downside is they run out of sharp edges quickly, which makes finer lines in a coloring book a titch difficult but not really a complaint. I got the prismacolor sharpener as well, because God forbid all pencil sharpeners work on all pencils, but I digress, it they sharpen nicely. I would love to go the full monty and get the 100+ pack, not yet... But SOON!
customer_reviews.author: AH

customer_reviews.title: Best colored pencils ever!
customer_reviews.text: I use Prismacolors colors in my art class all the time and I completely fell in love, they're super smooth and they blend better than any other colored pencils I've tried. They make my art look really smooth and professional. When I saw these for $35 dollars I couldn't resist buying them because I've only ever seen them for $90+ so this is great deal. I highly recommend these for anyone trying to make their art look cleaner. Side note, since these pencils are very expensive due to their high quality, I don't reccomend getting them for your younger kids because they are likely to break them, lose them, and wear them down quickly. Crayola will work fine for them.
customer_reviews.author: Isy

customer_reviews.title: I kinda feel like an artist using these
customer_reviews.text: I am and adult and I color, sometimes I color a lot. It all depends on the mood. I use adult coloring books, plug for Millie Marotta here. These pencils can shade light, they can shade dark. They blend well. I kinda feel like an artist using these. No, I don't really, I feel like an adult that is coloring for all those reasons they suggest coloring. It really is relaxing and kind of addicting. These pencils they make it more so because they aren't breaking for no reason other than sharpening them. I use a Prismacolor sharpener which works fine, so I cannot comment on other sharpeners and these pencils
customer_reviews.author: BucksinBoston

customer_reviews.title: Very nice, good value
customer_reviews.text: I use these for adult coloring books and such, but have known about these for a long time. My dad used to use them for his sketches and I even used them when I was younger for art class. They are always my go-to pencils, for when I want something better than crayola, lol. These are great value, they are very nice to use overall, and don't cost nearly as much a pack of polychromus pencils. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Dylan Piekarski

customer_reviews.title: Lives up to the hype
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant to get these but after some research I decided to go ahead and buy them. My son loves these and his work turns out beautiful. From my own observation, they could have a better system of keeping them safe but hey...still a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Elle

customer_reviews.title: Colors great; difficulty sharpening
customer_reviews.text: I'm new to colored pencils and researched extensively before purchasing these in December of '13. All was fine until I needed to sharpen. I had purchased a brand new Prismacolor sharpener at the same time (, but struggled with several colors. My Yellow Ochre will not sharpen- the color breaks and falls out. This is extremely disappointing. A look at their blog tells me they're quite aware of the issue, so maybe in the future it will be solved. For now, I'm on the hunt for a different sharpener. Suggestions more than welcome. As for the colors themselves, I absolutely love them.
customer_reviews.author: amsd2dth

customer_reviews.title: I love them!
customer_reviews.text: I recently took up coloring and these pencils have been my favorite. They blend seamlessly and are so buttery compared to cheaper colored pencils. The colors are so vibrant. They are definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Intuitive pencils?  The color goes where I want it to! And I don't have to tear the paper!
customer_reviews.text: These are a dream! Every other color pencils I've used (won't name the other 3 brands) have nothing to compare with these! Where you have to basically have to grind the other pencils to get pigment into your image; these seem to flow like paint. Smooth, creamy...I thought I was silly but had the hubby try and he agreed. It's almost as if the color wants to leap from the pencil to the paper it spreads easy, blends wonderfully and never becomes oversaturated. It's fair to say, I'll never buy another brand!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy Hatmaker

customer_reviews.title: Best colored pencils!
customer_reviews.text: I did a lot of research on colored pencils for bible journaling. These were by far the popular choice. I had first bought crayola twistables and found them way too waxy and they applied the color unevenly. So I decided to upgrade to the prismacolor. Great choice! These pencils arrived in ONE day!!!! They were in perfect condition. I saw a few reviews saying the pencils arrived damaged or other types of prismacolor pencils arrived in the tin. Mine were perfect. No complaints here. I am in love!!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer 36

customer_reviews.title: Vibrant! Will buy again!
customer_reviews.text: So vibrant. I have always used cheap colored pencils. I knew I wanted a better brand. When I colored with these, I was so impressed by the vibrancy of the colors. You do not have to layer upon layer. Say bye to pressing hard. These are awesome. Will buy more to add to my collection.
customer_reviews.author: lorie

customer_reviews.title: the best colored pencils I've ever used (I haven't used many ...
customer_reviews.text: Wow, the best colored pencils I've ever used (I haven't used many but I am extremely picky about anything I purchase). They blend well, are soft, made well, vibrant and very elegant. I bought these to use with my adult coloring books (not the kind you're thinking!). I find it difficult to truly relax and these pencils and coloring give my otherwise active mind a welcome respite. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a new relaxing past time. Well worth the money. It elevates coloring to a new level.
customer_reviews.author: shulover

customer_reviews.title: These colors go on paper like butter, they are so fun to color with
customer_reviews.text: These colors go on paper like butter, they are so fun to color with. They feel almost like using crayons since they glide on so smoothly. These Prismacolors are nothing like I remember colored pencils being way back in the 70s. They also sharpen quickly and no lead breakage or wood splintering. Coloring, and sharpening are a real joy. I find myself coloring way longer than I should and neglect my other duties. Prismacolors are very addictive. They should come with a warning label! I am truly in love with them.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Donaldson

customer_reviews.title: My preferred color pencils.
customer_reviews.text: I just got these pencils, but they are better than ones I have had before in which the leads would break during sharpening. The Prismacolor pencils color the page more easily. I'm guessing this is due to the ingredients of the leads which may have a slightly more oil nature to it? Previous pencils have had had were more dry and did not color the page as easily. I have not had much sharpening experience with them, but they more smoothly and completely color the page.
customer_reviews.author: D. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Vivid colors
customer_reviews.text: Very nice set. I just used these this afternoon and I am very impressed with how easily you can lay down color and blend them, very nice pigment. I am looking forward to using them more. I am not an artist but have used a lot of colored pencils, mostly from walmart type stores but these and my Prismacolor Watercolors are far above the others if you are looking for better quality. I know walmart has them sometimes in stock, but this was a far better price when I purchased them from Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Smooth and buttery lead that blends well
customer_reviews.text: I bought these pencils when they were part of a daily deal a couple months ago. I had wanted some high quality pencils and was so excited to try these for my new found coloring hobby. The lead of these pencils is much softer than any other color pencil I've used. The colors are very rich and the more you layer the color the more vibrant they become. They also blend like butter to create a seamless transition between colors. If you love coloring and want a nice smooth buttery pencil this is the pencil for you. I would totally buy this again at full price.
customer_reviews.author: Verdell82

customer_reviews.title: These are fantastic colored pencils
customer_reviews.text: These are fantastic colored pencils. They seem to be preferred by a lot of real artists, but they are affordable enough that you can get them for your kids to experiment with. This box of 48 provides a reasonable variety of colors. I don't think most people will feel limited by this assortment. The pencils are soft enough that you can get a lot of color on the page without undue effort. My daughters love these. Pros: * Good quality pencils * Good colors * Good assortment of colors * Good value Cons: -none-
customer_reviews.author: C. Kopp

customer_reviews.title: Good pencils
customer_reviews.text: Really good pencils. I have found another brand (Arteza's are a great pencil also for the money!) First star knocked off: I will recommend these for great quality, but out of the 4 sets I have purchased I've had a great deal of trouble with broken leads... contacted the company and it is a lot of work to try to get replacements. 2nd star knocked off: One of the sets I purchased were different colors than some of the others I had, same color name and same #'d pencils
customer_reviews.author: Kat M

customer_reviews.title: Prismacolor premier Colored Pencils
customer_reviews.text: I have always used Prismacolor Pencils for drawing and coloring. For years it was graphs and theories I drew and colored for presentation to groups at work and classes in graduate school. Now, retired, I'm coloring in Adult Coloring Books - and I chose Prismacolors to do this. They work very well. The way they work is, color lightly for paler color, or color you wish to blend, and color lightly and repeatedly over an area for deeper color. Nice! I'm not sure if 48 is going to be enough colors, though! I may have to get the next size up.
customer_reviews.author: Eliz-R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I had my doubts since I ahve read so many negative reviews about Prismacolor and their current quality. However, I must say this is the 3rd set I purchase (2 for myself and one for my mother). We are both artists and we couldn't be happier. Their quality is beyond any other brand
customer_reviews.author: Maria Gabriela

customer_reviews.title: These are perfect and a great price compared to the craft stores in my area.
customer_reviews.text: These are perfect and a great price compared to the craft stores in my area. Everyone in my family loves to draw, including me. We have all used these pencils even though they were a Christmas gift to my son. Both of my children draw anime, my husband draws cars and motorcycles, and I draw plants and island tribal for tattoos. These pencils work for all of them. Easy to work with them for lining and shading. We loved them so much that we purchased other sets.
customer_reviews.author: Anakalia - Red Herring

customer_reviews.title: Stepping Beyond the Average Colored Pencil
customer_reviews.text: Since I couldn't purchase another Francie coloring book by Whitman, I went for the next best thing and picked up some fun grownup coloring books. I tried markers for these books and they work great, but I was told that a good colored pencil could do so much more. At the advice of a friend I ordered the Prismacolor Premier Colored Pencils. The 48 colors cover just about anything I want to color and you can blend and combine the colors if you take your time. I am not an artist, just a lover of coloring, and these make me look good!
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Blackwell - Here's My Take On It

customer_reviews.title: Loved them
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want to buy these colors, because I was afraid to receive them broken, or open box, or damaged in some other way as colors and pencils are so fragile. Also it has been a long time ago since I tried prismacolors so I was hesitant to find out the quality not being the same as it used to be. But the colors are simply the best. I really appreciate that they arrived in great shape. They are so rich, brilliant and feel so nice in the hand. They still the awesome quality that I remembered. I also liked very much the tin where they are stored.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Inferior pencils
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed in the quality of these pencils. Out of the 72 pack I have had about 8 that won't sharpen. Every time you sharpen them the lead falls out. Then I've had 3 that are cracked completely through and 2 that the lead comes out of the opposite end. Not happy at all when I spent all this money on pencils and they turn out inferior.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Really enjoy and like these!
customer_reviews.text: I received these as a Christmas gift from my husband. They are AMAZING! I use them for the adult coloring books and for my scrapbooking. The colors are vivid. They are uniform. There are a LOT of them! Which I totally LOVE! I love variety and to have lots of options. The case is a metal tin and there are two trays inside and that keeps the pencils in neat and orderly fashion (something I also like HeHe) so you can see all the colors at a glance. Very good quality. When sharpened doesn't waste any of the actual color. Holds a point very well.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi Jones

customer_reviews.title: These are wonderful colored pencils
customer_reviews.text: These are wonderful colored pencils, I've wanted a set since I was in middle school...only took me about 25 years to buy my own. Becasue they're softcore you would have to sharpen really pointy to be able to do small detail work, the prismacolor verithin would be better for that. But these provide wonderful rich color, great pigmentation. My biggest issue is the tin. I miss the stand up box that these came in years ago, which some of the other prismacolor pencils still come in. I find the trays annoying because of the extra room they take up on the desk.
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: Best colored pencils ever
customer_reviews.text: Love these colored pencils. They are so vibrant and almost look velvety. I had some of these years and years ago, so I had to buy them again for my second round of coloring and they are still the best in my opinion. This set is a much larger set than I have ever owned and the color choices are nothing short of wonderful. I know these are a little pricey but they are cheaper on Amazon than I could buy them locally. I have a couple adult coloring books and these along with some gel pens will work great.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful colors however quality not exactly as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I was so happy to finally try prisma colors however was disappointed that one green and one pink would not sharpen without breaking. For being top of the line pencils I didnt expect that. And yes I do have the prismacolor pencil sharpener
customer_reviews.author: NatalieNicollee

customer_reviews.title: Maybe a bad batch? Could it explain the extreme price difference ...
customer_reviews.text: Have to use a very gentle hand when sharpening otherwise they continually break. These must use a different formula than my old sets because I've never had this problem before. Maybe a bad batch? Could it explain the extreme price difference between every place else and Amazon?
customer_reviews.author: Ryno D. Bones

customer_reviews.title: Lead breaks.
customer_reviews.text: The colored pencil part just falls out when you go to color with these. I am bummed my window to returned these has passed otherwise I would exchange for a new set in case I just got a set that has been dropped to many times or something like that. They are pretty much unusable. They were a gift for my mom so she just started using them to close to the return date.
customer_reviews.author: allyalicia

customer_reviews.title: Great colors
customer_reviews.text: I love these pencils because of their bright vivid color selection and the ease of blending to create depth . These can also be bought individually so when you use the last of your favorite color There is no need to but a whole box to replace just a few. They shade so nice and my wrist doesn't get tired from having to use a lot of pressure. The pencils color very nice on any kind of paper but on really smooth paper there is a pretty heavy wax coat. I always try to catch this brand when they are on sale because they are a higher end product.
customer_reviews.author: Sandmit

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves the Prisma color pencils she was very excited to use them. We open the box and the metallic box got damaged. I like to get good presentation which I also paid for. They should send it in a box instead of a bag that way product doesnt get damaged.
customer_reviews.author: Denise QV

customer_reviews.title: Prismacolor Rules
customer_reviews.text: I love my Prismacolor pencils. They are better than the Crayola brand and also the Crazy Art brand since the colored leads are softer allowing the artist to put more color down. Originally I bought a smaller box of 24 pencils but should have gotten this larger box originally as one needs more variation in colors. Note that this larger box contains all of the colors in the smaller box with additionall shades or variations of color. I did notice some of the newer pencils broke more frequently but I'm thinking it might be because I now need a sharper pencil sharpener.
customer_reviews.author: Lopa

customer_reviews.title: Deep rich colors
customer_reviews.text: Love this handsome box of colored pencils -- I was admiring the richness of color in a drawing one of my students had done, and she recommended these pencils. I bought them as a gift, and apparently they did not disappoint!
customer_reviews.author: Edith Hankel

customer_reviews.title: Great quality adult pencils
customer_reviews.text: I already own a larger set of Prismacolor pencils, but purchased this set for my 10 yr old granddaughter. I also got her the blending pencils. These soft pencils are bright and bold on their own, but when you use a blending pencil over your work, it brightens it colors even more. I love Prismacolor, and have never been disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: BlueStars

customer_reviews.title: so it's worth paying for good quality. These are solid quality at a reasonable ...
customer_reviews.text: Real quality can't be substituted for. An artist doesn't need to be fighting with substandard media, so it's worth paying for good quality. These are solid quality at a reasonable price. I don't think you have to pay any more for the "primo" brand pencils. I guess maybe some have been mistreated in handling before being shipped out, if we are to believe some of the "broken lead" reviews. That wasn't the case with this set, so I think it may just be an isolated incident.
customer_reviews.author: D. Fitzjarrell

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful and vibrant
customer_reviews.text: Love these--one tip if you have a bunch of them breaking every 1/4 inch, is to try to sharpen while holding the pencil right at the pencil sharpener. If you hold it up a ways, it's easy to move the pencil around and break the lead as you sharpen. Not discounting others' experiences of receiving pencils that were handled poorly during shipping, just mentioning something else that might help. The pencils are softer than traditional colored pencils and color beautifully. I wish I had bought a bigger set!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Mccafferty

customer_reviews.title: ... tips keep breaking dont know if i got a bad set or
customer_reviews.text: these are awful they keep spliting and the tips keep breaking dont know if i got a bad set or what
customer_reviews.author: A

customer_reviews.title: Superb assortment
customer_reviews.text: Keep coming back to these pencils time and time again because of the saturated colors, blending, and versatility. This 48 pencil set is the best for beginners because it includes enough variety in tone to get started.
customer_reviews.author: Colorista

product_meta.title: Prismacolor 3598T 48 Piece Prismacolor Colored Art Pencil Set, Multicolor
product_meta.description:
Size:48-Count| Color:Assorted| Product Packaging:Standard PackagingBring out the soft side of any illustration or art project with Prismacolor Premier Colored Pencils featuring soft cores. Inside the box you’ll find 48 colored pencils featuring creamy cores that are the artist’s choice for blending, shading and layering. Prismacolor pencils have pigments of unmatched quality and leads that are strong enough to be sharpened to a precision point. That means you can effortlessly switch between powerful lines, delicate blends and silky shadowing.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
Designed to handle detailed work for advanced students and artists, these Prismacolor Premier Colored Pencils feature high grade pigments for rich color saturation. Other features include soft, thick cores for superior blending and shading, and a color coded woodcasing for easy identification. The soft cores also resist breaking. Designed with professional artist quality for every level of expertise, these pencils come in an assorted set of 48, and include a convenient tin case.

 What's in the Box
Set of 48 assorted Prismacolor Premier Colored Woodcase Pencils, and tin case.
feature_bullets: Soft, thick cores are perfect for shading and shadows
Thick, robust leads resist cracking and chipping, making them perfect for adult coloring books

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars27,315 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
